org.openbase.jul.schedule

Class RecurrenceEventFilter<VALUE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openbase.jul.schedule.RecurrenceEventFilter<VALUE>
  • Type Parameters:
    VALUE - 

    public abstract class RecurrenceEventFilter<VALUE>
extends Object
    Author:
    Divine Threepwood RecurrenceEventFilter helps to filter high frequency events. After a new incoming event is processed, all further incoming events are skipped except of the last event which is executed after the defined timeout is reached.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecurrenceEventFilter

        public RecurrenceEventFilter()
        Constructor creates a new RecurrenceEventFilter instance pre-configured with the given DEFAULT_MAX_FREQUENCY.

      • RecurrenceEventFilter

        public RecurrenceEventFilter(long maxFrequency)
        Constructor creates a new RecurrenceEventFilter instance pre-configured with the given maxFrequency.
        Parameters:
        maxFrequency - this is the maximum frequency in milliseconds where triggered events are relayed.

    • Method Detail

      • trigger

        public void trigger()
             throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method triggers the relay if no trigger was relayed within the defined max frequency. Note: Triggers are maybe filtered but the last trigger call will always result in a relay to guarantee the latest event will relayed.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if the trigger could not be handled (e.g. because of a system shutdown).

      • trigger

        public void trigger(VALUE value)
             throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method triggers the relay if no trigger was relayed within the defined max frequency. Note: Triggers are maybe filtered but the last trigger call will always result in a relay to guarantee the latest value will relayed.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value which should be published via the next relay.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if the trigger could not be handled (e.g. because of a system shutdown).

      • trigger

        public void trigger(boolean immediately)
             throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method triggers the relay if no trigger was relayed within the defined max frequency or the immediately flag was set. Note: Triggers are maybe filtered but the last trigger call will always result in a relay to guarantee the latest event will relayed.
        Parameters:
        immediately - this flag forces the trigger to relay immediately without respect to the defined max frequency.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if the trigger could not be handled (e.g. because of a system shutdown).

      • trigger

        public void trigger(VALUE value,
                    boolean immediately)
             throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method triggers the relay if no trigger was relayed within the defined max frequency or the immediately flag was set. Note: Triggers are maybe filtered but the last trigger call will always result in a relay to guarantee the latest value will relayed.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value which should be published via the next relay.
        immediately - this flag forces the trigger to relay immediately without respect to the defined max frequency.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if the trigger could not be handled (e.g. because of a system shutdown).

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Method cancels depending triggers which were not relayed yet.

      • getLastValue

        @Deprecated
public VALUE getLastValue()
        Deprecated. please use getLatestValue() instead.
        Method returns the latest triggered value.
        Returns:
        the last value or null if no last value is available

      • getLatestValue

        public VALUE getLatestValue()
                     throws NotAvailableException
        Method returns the latest triggered value.
        Returns:
        the latest value.
        Throws:
        NotAvailableException - is thrown if a value was never triggered.

      • isTriggered

        public boolean isTriggered()
        Method returns if this instance was ever triggered since startup or since the last reset.
        Returns:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Method cancels all depending triggers and resets the triggered flag as well as resets the lastValue to null.

      • relay

        public void relay(VALUE value)
           throws Exception
        Method can be overwritten to get frequently informed about trigger actions and the related new value. Note: Be informed that by overwriting this method the default relay() will not be called anymore.
        Parameters:
        value - the latest value is passed via this argument.
        Throws:
        Exception - can be thrown during the relay. The exception will just be printed on the error channel.

      • relay

        public abstract void relay()
                    throws Exception
        Method should be overwritten to get frequently informed about trigger actions.
        Throws:
        Exception - can be thrown during the relay. The exception will just be printed on the error channel.
